summary: This is a note to file from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York documenting a voicemail and follow-up call from an individual who wanted to discuss treason, Jeffrey Epstein, and Ghislaine Maxwell. The attorney directed the caller to the office's main line and did not engage in discussion.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the note who received a voicemail and a follow-up call from an individual wanting to discuss treason, Epstein, and Maxwell, and directed the caller to the office's main line.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by the caller as one of the topics he wanted to discuss, along with treason and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned by the caller as one of the topics he wanted to discuss, along with treason and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Caller contacts AUSA about Epstein/Maxwell
events.description: An individual called an Assistant United States Attorney, left a voicemail, and then called back. The caller stated he wanted to talk about treason, Jeffrey Epstein, and Ghislaine Maxwell. The attorney declined to discuss and directed him to the office's main line.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations.name: One Saint Andrews Plaza
locations.context: Address of the Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office in New York, NY.

locations.name: New York, NY
locations.context: Location of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: An Assistant United States Attorney in the SDNY received an unsolicited call from an individual wanting to discuss treason, Jeffrey Epstein, and Ghislaine Maxwell in May 2021.
The attorney did not engage with the caller on the topic and directed him to the office's main phone line.
The document is a contemporaneous note to file documenting this contact, which suggests ongoing public interest in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The call occurred after Epstein's death and during Maxwell's prosecution, indicating the case continued to generate outside communications to prosecutors.
